definition: to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
thinking and pondering (idiom); to turn sth over in one's mind/to consider repeatedly
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
to stir up trouble at every opportunity (idiom)
past one's prime/in one's declining years
see 驚弓之鳥|惊弓之鸟[jing1 gong1 zhi1 niao3]
lit. to live on dry provisions and wild herbs (idiom)/fig. to live in abject poverty
day and night (to toil, to abandon oneself to pleasure etc)
lit. almanac from years back (idiom)/obsolete practice/old-fashioned principle
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
to receive an official's salary
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
a cut above/top quality
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
lit. to make night as day (idiom); fig. to burn the midnight oil/work especially hard
